articles.title: LATAM POLITICS TODAY-Argentina's president rejects Supreme Court ruling
articles.description: The latest in Latin American politics today: Argentine president says will ignore Supreme Court ruling BUENOS AIRES - Argentine President Alberto Fernandez sparked a battle with the country's top court after he said he would reject its ruling to give a larger proportion of state funds to the city of Buenos Aires.

articles.description: ‘Just vulgar’: Argentina branded ‘inelegant winners’ as France blasts ‘rather pathetic’ celebrations
articles.content:
French Sports Minister Amelie Oudea-Castera on Friday accused Argentine players of being “inelegant winners” and “vulgar” for mocking her country’s star Kylian Mbappe after winning the World Cup final.

articles.title: CBOT soybeans lifts on exports; Argentine forecast caps gains
articles.description: CHICAGO, Dec 23 (Reuters) - Chicago Board of Trade soybean futures gained on Friday, supported by fresh export sales, although forecasts for rain in Argentina capped gains, analysts said. NOTE: U.S. grain markets will be closed on Monday for the Christmas holiday, reopening at 8:30 a.m. CST (1430 GMT) on Tuesday. * The benchmark CBOT January soybean futures contract firmed
